info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 10:49PM EDT until April 10 at 7:04AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river and locations in Indiana...
White River at Muncie, near Centerton, at Edwardsport, and at Elliston.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following river and locations in Indiana...
White River at Anderson, near Nora, at Noblesville, below Eagle Valley Power Plant, at Ravenswood, at Newberry, at Spencer, at Hazleton, and at Petersburg.
.Widespread and significant flooding is in progress. Rains of four to over six inches has fallen.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River near Centerton.
* WHEN...Until Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.8 feet, Flood waters cover the flood plain along SR 39 connecting SRs 37 and 67 just southwest of Martinsville. Flooding causes the evacuation of a few homes and damages Blue Bluff Road near IPL Power Plant. Local river roads are impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM EDT Saturday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Sunday afternoon by around 300 PM EDT /200 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Monroe, IN; Morgan, IN; Owen, IN
